reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Grand Case
reviews.text: After just returning from my week vacation at the Grand Case, I have to say I had a wonderful time. I still find myself thinking about the staff at this resort as they were so kind and attentive. I found the staff to be attentive and wonderful on all levels from the cleaning professionals to the waiters to groundskeepers to the front desk. Everyone and I do mean everyone was kind and attentive to my needs. I typically stay in larger resorts so when I first arrived at Grand Case I was a bit hesitant, but immediately the hotel staff made me feel welcomed and all doubts went away. I wish I could remeber the names of all the wonderful staff to give them the kudos they deserve. However, I do remember Ruth and Roselyn who work the front desk...they were wonderful. Dawn, the waitress at the restaurant, Sunset Cafe who was gracious and helpful. Alan and Sebastian who really help me and my family map out my tours. The two wonderful women who worked the car rental were also great and help put me at ease in driving in a country new to me. If you are looking for kind atttentive staff who will sincerely try to meet all of your needs, then Grand Case is the resort for you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed for 4 nights. Since it was considered off season, some of the units were undergoing renovation, but we never heard any noise or were inconvenienced in any way. We booked a standard studio but were upgraded to a one-bedroom loft at no charge. Rooms were clean, with well-kept furnishings, and we had a balcony with an ocean view, which allowed us to take in some beautiful sunsets. The grounds were very nice, and a choice of two small beaches with complimentary chairs, umbrellas and water toys added to the relaxed nature of the hotel. Continental breakfast (juice, coffee and pastries) at the Sunset cafe was included with the room. If you wanted more for breakfast, you could order off a menu, but had to pay additional. Also, since the Sunset Cafe is managed separately from the hotel, you could not charge any meals to your room. The hotel has its own security guards and electronic gates, but we didn't really see the need, as the area around Grand Case seemed pretty safe. The main street of Grand case is only a 10-minute walk from the hotel, and there are more than enough great restaurants and bars there. Also, a local grocery store if you would like to buy food and drink to keep in your room refrigerator. Some of the great beaches, such as Orient, Friars Bay and Happy Bay are only about a 10-minute drive from the hotel. Finally, the hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. Overall, a very enjoyable stay, and we would definitely return to the Grand Case Beach Club.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Low-Key Hotel in Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at GCBC the 1st week of September and were very satisfied with the property, service and location. The accomodations were spotless and well maintained. It is an older property, and is not the Four Seasons, but the value for the money was extraordinary. There were two separate beaches, one on each side of the Sunset Cafe and there were always beach chairs, lounges, etc., which were stored every night and put back out on the beach early every morning.
reviews.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants in Grand Case are comparable in price to NYC and most certainly no more expensive than any European city that we visit - and the food was as one would expect in a French island - top notch. We never, ever, smelled any sewerage at any time nor did we have any problems with privacy in our 2 story, 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bath villa with a full kitchen. Again, it is an older property, but it is spotlessly clean, well maintained with an excellent staff. To those who expect a property like the Four Seasons in Nevis (where we have also stayed) then they should make that their venue choice and pay the $600 per night, and stick to fast food outlets if you are not prepared to pay typical big city prices for a meal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 7 day stay at GCBC. We had a lovely oceanfront studio. Although it was small it was just what we were looking for. Neat, clean steps from the most beautiful,clear blue water and small sandy beach. The room had a kitchette so we were able to buy food and drinks at a nearby grocery store. The breakfast that came with the package was basic but good. Fresh bread,coffee and juice. On Monday night there was a manager's reception that was great fun. The onsite restaurant was good and the view from the deck it is on was beautiful. The only negative for us was the bar. The bartender was not very pleasant and actually seemed annoyed that we wanted a drink. One night my glass of wine had a huge smear of butter on it. There was no bar menu and the drinks were very expensive even at Happy Hour.We ended up buying some wine in town and had our own Happy Hour on our little patio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The husband and I stayed at Grand Case beach club for 5 nights. Our room was big enough, and the bathroom was of normal size. Nonetheless, there was a constant pee smell in the bathroom even though the cleaning lady came everyday. My husband who's an engineer determined that it was the way the sewage system was done. We were eventually transferred to another room which was better. The rooms don't compare to those in the usual resorts that you find in Mexico for example. Our room was beachfront and that was very nice. The sunset cafe is the only restaurant at the hotel, which is very inconvenient in terms of choices. We have stayed at hotels with at a minimum of two restaurants. The sunset cafe charges much more money for nothing spectacular. They were charging a 1.20 exchange rate for the Euro, even though most place were 1 for 1. A 10 mins walk from the hotel and there are plenty of places to choose from. We rented a car and went everywhere in St Martin from Marigot, simpson bay, Anse marcel, orient bay, mullet bay. I would strongly suggest renting a car to explore the island. Every beach is even more beautiful then the other and venturing gives you a much bigger perspective of the island. In general there was no entertainment on the french side, but more than enough to do on the Dutch side around Simpson Bay area there are many little night clubs with live bands and the food is great. We rented the car from the car rental at the hotel for $35/day with full coverage.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week's vacation at the Grand Case Beach Club and it was exceptional. If you are looking for a relaxing spot with great restaurants nearby, the GCBC is ideal. If you are looking for a trendy resort with a swim up bar and dancing till dawn, look elsewhere. We are content to sit on the beach, read, relax and swim. Our 3 teenage daughters were quite content. There were young couples, older couples, families with small children and families with teengagers. The service was excellent and the staff was accomodating. The rooms were clean, and spacious with flat screen TV's with all the American cable channels. We had a full kitchen which we used often.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Case village is also quite nice. Every night, we walked into town for dinner: we went to Le Pressoir, L'Esplanade, Le Ti Coin Creole, L'Hibiscus, Auberge Gourmande, and Le Tastevin. Favorites were Le Pressoir (excellent food), Le Ti Coin Creole (a unique ambiance and food in a sea of French restaurant, not to mention a very friendly owner and a surprise trio of "rum punches" served after dessert), and L'Hibiscus. Also worth noting are the Lolos, where we had lunch twice. Very tasty and a bit more local flavor than the restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed at GCGB the week of July 23 - 30, 2007. We were in St. Martin for a wedding and used the week for our honeymoon. We had a 1 bedroom studio on the beach. It had a small kitchen, microwave, refrigerator, safe, CD player and television. It was a 5 or 10 minute walk to most of the great restaurants in Grand Case. Spiga was a five minute walk and the food was excellent. Orient Beach is around a 10 minute drive. Marigot is a 10 or 15 minute drive in the opposite direction. The closest casino is Princess Casino which is past Marigot along the shortest way back to the airport. You can get there in about 20 minutes. We both loved GCBC and would definetly go back. The AC stopped cooling one morning, but was fixed immediately. The hotel staff was great. We could easily never have left the property and been satisfied with our trip. The beach at GCBC was the best beach we saw for children. The sand was great, the water slowly got deeper (no drastic depth change) and it was still very smooth even on a windy day. The beach was never crowded and there was always more than enough lounge chairs for everyone. If you want a quiet place to get away from it all, this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Loved GCBC
